DOC.brief_summary: Randomized controlled single blind prospective comparative study
DOC.brief_title: A Comparative Study of Azithromycin and S-P as Prophylaxis in Pregnant HIV+ Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This study is intended to be a randomized controlled single blind prospective comparative study conducted to compare the efficacy of three monthly doses of sulphadoxine-pyrimethamine as intermittent preventive therapy for malaria with azithromycin in HIV positive pregnant women
DOC.criteria: Pregnant HIV positive patients, Gestational age 16 weeks and above, No history of azithromycin or sulphadoxinepyrimethamine use four weeks prior to recruitment Anaemia packed cell volume less than 30%, preexisting medical conditions diabetes mellitus, hypertension, allergy to sulphadoxinepyrimethamine or azithromycin
